item.title: Adam add a quote by Rem Koolhaas
item.description: "There are books that I own that somehow even without reading them they mean something to me. So I think people have a relationship with books in a library whether you’ve come specifically to read them or not." -- Rem Koolhaas

item.title: Adam add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The tavern will compare favorably with the church." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Adam add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "The most profound enchantment for the collector is the locking of individual items within a magic circle in which they are fixed as the final thrill, the thrill of acquisition, passes over them." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Adam add a quote by Gerhard Kopf
item.description: "The state of admiration is a condition of feeblemindedness. Most people are feebleminded all their lives only because they admire. Only a dimwit admires, the smart one doesn’t admire: he respects, observes, understands." -- Gerhard Kopf

item.title: Adam add a quote by Pico Della Mirandola
item.description: "A sacred pride should grip us of not being satisfied with the mediocre but to strive (for we can do it, if we want to) with the exertion of all our strength to attain the highest. Let us scorn what is of this earth, let us ignore what is of heaven, let us leave absolutely everything worldly behind us in order to hasten to the abode out of this world, in the proximity of the sublime deity. We do not need to think of stepping back. Of being satisfied with second rank, let us strive for dignity and glory. To attain the highest." -- Pico Della Mirandola

item.title: Adam add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A building has integrity just like a man. And just as seldom." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Adam add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Every man builds his world in his own image; he has the power to choose, but no power to escape the necessity of choice. If he abdicates his power, he abdicates the status of man, and the grinding chaos of the irrational is what he achieves as his sphere of existence—by his own choice." -- Ayn Rand
